#Setup with jar-download or maven pom

= Project setup =

GCMUtils must be added to the Android app project as a dependency.

==Direct project dependency==

This can be done by simply downloading the jar-files (gcm-client-utils.jar and gcm-common-utils.jar) and adding them to your libs folder.

==Maven setup==

Include the Google code repositories in your pom.xml file:
{{{
<repositories>
  <repository>
  <id>gcmutils-repo-releases</id>
  <url>http://gcmutils.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/repository/releases</url>
</repository>
<repository>
  <id>gcmutils-repo-snapshots</id>
  <url>http://gcmutils.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/repository/snapshots</url>
  </repository>
</repositories>
}}}

Then add the required dependency:
{{{
<dependency>
  <groupId>net.jarlehansen.android.gcm</groupId>
  <artifactId>gcm-client-utils</artifactId>
  <version><latest-version></version>
</dependency>
}}}
